titleStmt.title: Two precious and divine antidotes against the plague of pestilence; or any other judgement incident vnto vs Giving excellent instructions and comforts vnto all that well vse them in time of neede. The first prescribing holy preservatiues against this, or any other plague: written by a Christian and charitable well-willer vnto his countrey. The second, setting downe sweete consolations for such as be visited by the plague: written by a famous, learned, and faithfull pastour, vnto some of his flocke in the time of their visitations.
titleStmt.author: S. P., fl. 1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed [by J. Dawson] for Nathanael Nevvbery,

notesStmt.note: The second antidote is signed at end: Your loving pastour, S.P.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
